qas.question: What is one way to implement destination control?

answers.text: every user gets an RFID card to identify himself

qas.question: How does this help the system?

answers.text: the system knows every user call and can cancel the first call if the passenger decides to travel to another destination to prevent empty calls

qas.question: Newer systems know where and how many people are at a location for what reasons?

answers.text: either for the purposes of evacuating the building or for security reasons

context: To prevent this problem, in one implementation of destination control, <a0_0>every user gets an RFID card to identify himself<a0_0/>, so <a1_0>the system knows every user call and can cancel the first call if the passenger decides to travel to another destination to prevent empty calls<a1_0/>. The newest invention knows even where people are located and how many on which floor because of their identification, <a2_0>either for the purposes of evacuating the building or for security reasons<a2_0/>. Another way to prevent this issue is to treat everyone travelling from one floor to another as one group and to allocate only one car for that group.
